headline: Trump’s Tariffs Send Copper to Record, Dow Industrials Slip
summary: Copper prices surged and the Dow industrials slipped on Tuesday after President Trump announced a surprisingly large tariff on imports of the metal, and declared that he would hold firm on his latest deadline for trade deals with foreign countries.  Speaking at a cabinet meeting, Trump said the U.S. would impose 50% tariffs on copper—a component of electrical wiring, motors and many consumer goods.  Front-month U.S. copper futures soared 13% to settle at an all-time high of $5.6450 per pound, in their biggest one-day move in records going back to 1968, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

Speaking at a cabinet meeting, Trump said the U.S. would impose 50% tariffs on copper—a component of electrical wiring, motors and many consumer goods.  Front-month U.S. copper futures soared 13% to settle at an all-time high of $5.6450 per pound, in their biggest one-day move in records going back to 1968, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Freeport-McMoRan, First Solar, Amazon, Moderna
summary: ↗️ Freeport-McMoran (FCX): Shares of the copper mining company advanced 2.5% after President Trump announced that a 50% tariff was coming on imports of the industrial metal. ↘️ Sunrun (RUN), Enphase Energy (ENPH), First Solar (FSLR): Solar stocks fell Tuesday after the White House said it would enforce the halt to clean-electricity tax credits faster than expected.

headline: Mining Stocks Jump as Trump Slaps 50% Tariffs on Copper Imports
summary: Copper futures surged on the news, market the largest single-day dollar and percentage gain on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Freeport-McMoRan Stock Jumps as Trump Says He'll Impose 50% Copper Import Tariff
summary: Shares of American metals firm Freeport-McMoRan surged Tuesday as President Donald Trump said at a Cabinet meeting that he would impose a 50% tariff on copper imports.

headline: Broadcom and 13 Other Stocks That Have Come Too Far, Too Fast
summary: Since then, President Donald Trump has paused many tariffs, while the existing ones haven’t stoked much inflation, which remains a bit below 3%.  As a result, investors are betting the Federal Reserve, which has an inflation goal of 2%, will cut interest rates this year, which would help extend the economic expansion.  An improving economic outlook helps to explain the rebound: Many of them have earnings that are fairly sensitive to changes in demand for goods and services.

headline: Stocks slip, US copper jumps as Trump plans tariff on imported copper
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Major stock indexes mostly inched lower and U.S. copper prices jumped to a record high on Tuesday as U.S. President Donald Trump announced he would impose a 50% tariff on imported copper, broadening his global trade war.  Trump also said levies on semiconductors and pharmaceuticals were coming soon.  U.S. Comex copper futures jumped more than 12% to a record high after Trump announced the planned tariff.
